law.catch_line: Recognition of expense in regulation of rates.

text.section:
Sec. 29-41. Recognition of expense in regulation of rates.
All reasonable expense incurred by a seller in making the collections and remittances and in fulfilling the duties prescribed herein is hereby declared to be and to constitute an operating expense and shall be accorded full recognition as such in the establishment of rates and charges for rendering electric, metered gas, bottled gas, coal, fuel oil, or water service in the County.
